appAlert.500: An unexpected error occurred, please try again later.
appAlert.400: Items seem to be missing, please fill in the following fields
appAlert.401: You are not authorized to do this action.
appAlert.422: The following elements do not seem to be correct :

search.searchLabel: Look for a crag, a route, a gym, etc.

session.connectAlert: You must be logged in to access this page

gym.firstSpaceExplain: The spaces allow you to fill in your routes and boulders so that your climbers can consult them and keep a notebook of ascents!
gym.createDifficultyFirst: But before creating your spaces, you have to fill in your difficulty systems
gym.firstDifficultySystemExplain: Difficulty systems allow you to define how your quotations work in your climbing gym.
gym.firstDifficultySystemExplainTow: They also allow you to go faster in the information your routes.
gym.administratorRequired: You must be a gym administrator to access this page.

gymAdmin.welcome: Welcome to the administration page of %{name}

gymAdministrationRequest.isAlreadyAdministered: This gym is already managed by its manager.
gymAdministrationRequest.needAccount: To take over the management of a climbing gym, you need an oblyk account in your name.
gymAdministrationRequest.explainJustification: Please fill out the form below and give us some information that will allow us to verify that you are entitled to manage this climbing gym.
gymAdministrationRequest.requestIsSent:
We have registered your request !
We will process it as soon as possible.

gymSpace.name: Space
gymSpace.explain:
A "space" and a large area of a room that can contain several sectors. example: "Lane space", "Block space", "Pan", etc.
It is up to you to find the best division for your room.
gymSpace.explainMissingPlan: Upload a plan of <cite>"%{name}"</cite> on which you can draw the sectors.

gymSector.addNewExplain: A sector is a small division of a space, for example: The large slope, slabs, etc.. This is where the lines will be filled in.
gymSector.explainGroupName: You can group your corridors / sectors with 'Group name', example you can have 3 sectors: 'Corridor 1', 'Corridor 2', 'Corridor 3', grouped in 'Slabs'.
gymSector.editSectorPolygon: Edit the drawing on the plan
gymSector.clicOnPlan: Click on the map, or move the white wrists to edit the plot of the area on the map.

gymRoute.multiPitchRoute: Route with more than one pitch

gymGrade.noSystem: No system of difficulty is currently reported.
gymGrade.explain: The purpose of the difficulty systems is to make it easier for you to inform your lines afterwards.
gymGrade.whichSystem: How do you identify your routes? (grip color, label, etc.)
gymGrade.whichGradeSystem: What value system do you use to rate your routes?

gradeSystem.hold_color: The color of the holds indicate the difficulty <cite>(recommended for the block)</cite>.
gradeSystem.tag_color: The labels at the start of the routes indicate the difficulty <cite>(recommended for the private gym route)</cite>.
gradeSystem.pan: Labels on all holds of the route indicate difficulty <cite>(recommended for pan)</cite>.
gradeSystem.grade: No label, no specific hold color, the grade is indicated for the route <cite>(recommended for club track)</cite>.

gymSector.name: Secteur name
gymSector.can_be_more_than_one_pitch: Can have lines with more than one pitch
